inclusion_criteria: Study is explicitly about cyber attribution frameworks/models, or directly contributes methods for cyber attribution decisions.
Source provides substantive conceptual, methodological, legal, or empirical detail usable for synthesis.
Source is accessible with sufficient bibliographic and content metadata (title/abstract/full text or coded extract).
Source contributes to at least one synthesis dimension: evidence types, attribution methods, or framework operationalization.
exclusion_criteria: Source is out of scope (general cybersecurity without attribution-framework relevance).
Source lacks analyzable substance (insufficient methodological or argumentative detail).
Duplicate/near-duplicate record where another version has more complete metadata or content.
Source has no usable content for coding or synthesis after retrieval checks.
screening_note: Criteria tuned for literature-review synthesis rather than strict systematic review protocol filtering.
